Includes the development of appropriate tools, frameworks and initiatives and improved collaboration between state and local governments.
Enhancement of Holroyd City Council’s flood hazard mapping
Further development of Council’s flood hazard data to provide more complete and up to date flood hazard maps.
Hampden Road Reserve - flood detention basins
Construction of two flood detention basins to provide protection up to the 1 in 100 year flood event for nearby properties.
Enhancement of Lake Macquarie City Council’s GIS based harzard and flood data
Transfer of existing flood data into Council’s GIS system for improved accessibility by Council and combat agencies such as the State Emergency Service.
Shellharbour bushfire prevention and preparedeness project
Education program targeted to local residents living near bushland reserves to raise awareness about bushfire prevention and preparedness.
Development of bushfire management plans for reserves in Albion Park, Blackbutt, Croom, and Mount Warrigal.

This project consists of an integrated suite of communication tools (publication, multimedia display and CD ROM) to improve community awareness and readiness measures for residents living in high bushfire risk areas. It will enable such residents to better prepare them and their homes for a bushfire.
Real-time burnt area and flood mapping
Satellite mapping of flooded or burnt areas across Australia for improved emergency management.
Community layout planning for remote Aboriginal communities
Development of guidelines for the inclusion of emergency mitigation requirements into community layout planning for remote Aboriginal communities.
Fire and Emergency Services Authority of WA
Eidsvold to Theodore Road (Mt Steel area)
Eidsvold to Theodore Road is predominantly unsealed. Road works along two sections of this road will improve access in times of flooding for the townships of Cracow and Cloncose.

quote.para: Attachment B

entry.para: Augmentation of two low points in the Kelso levee to provide protection for up to 275 homes in the Panania area from Georges River flooding.
Undertake a pilot project in the Riverland to develop an implementation strategy for standardised addressing of all rural properties in South Australia.
Department of Administrative and Information Services
Conduct a disaster risk assessment and treatment study of all 15 local councils within the Central Local Government Region.
Central Local Government Region of South Australia
North Esk River flood warning and data acquisition system
Installation of telemetered river gauges on the North Esk River at Launceston.
Construction of a detention basin at Deverall Park to reduce flooding in the surrounding area near Milperra Road.
Mitcham Council Bushfire Risk Assessment Study
Conduct a bushfire risk assessment study and develop a community education strategy and works program for the Mitcham Fire Prone Area.
Lower Forth flood evacuation plan implementation measures
Identification of a 1:100 AEP for the Lower Forth Valley (including Forth, Leith, Turners Beach and Ulverstone) and accompanying education programme and evacuation plan.
Construct rock armoured headlands and undertake sand nourishment to address beach erosion at Kwinana Beach.
Capturing Small Landholdings Information for Disaster Mitigation and Management

Integrate the Client and Resource Information System and the Rural Street Addressing databases for small landholdings in 12 council areas on Perth’s fringe to improve their quality and effectiveness, so as to facilitate their use in disaster disaster mitigation, response and recovery.
Brisbane Valley Flood Drainage Minimisation Study

Collaborative regional project that will involve undertaking a flood study of the Brisbane River catchment area. This study provides an ideal opportunity for Federal, State and Local Governments and SEQ Water to work together to optimise the operations of dams so that the significant damage that can occur from flood events is minimised.
Flood study of the Greater Dandenong municipality.

Preparation of disaster risk management plans for each local government area within CENTROC (Bathurst Regional, Blayney, Cabonne, Cowra, Lachlan, Lithgow, Forbes, Mid Western, Oberon, Orange, Parkes, Weddin, Wellington).

Replacement of the existing lower level timber bridge at Kianga Creek with a 130 metre long concrete bridge providing two traffic lanes and associated approach roadworks. This will mean that the Moura community will not be isolated except in extreme flooding events significantly beyond a once in 50 year flood event.
Identify, analyse and evaluate the impact of flood events on the township of Alpha and will investigate the costs and benefits of various mitigation options.
Resurface the existing crossing at Southern Cross Floodway to increase the crossings resilience to water inundation from flooding.
Construct earth levees upstream to channel floodwaters to the creek and to culverts to allow the road at May Creek to withstand scouring by floodwaters and still remain passable.
Community and Fire Safety education days
Conduct Community and Fire Safety education days in Emerald Valley, Carabooda and Seatrees Estate, Two Rocks to raise community awareness about bushfires.
Flood study of the Upper Kalang River including Brierfield, Sunny Corner, Scotchman, Kooroowi and Kalang.
Flood hazard and risk study for Dorrigo township.
Establishment of asset protection zones along the urban - bushland interface of the Wollongong local government area.
Towradgi Creek - footbridge at Coolong Crescent
Raising of the Coolong Crescent footbridge in Wollongong to increase the waterway capacity and reduce flood levels upstream.
Hewitts Creek - sediment basin at Hobart Street
Construction of a sediment basin at Hobart Street, Wollongong to prevent culverts and bridges becoming blocked with debris during floods.
Hewitts Creek - flow path at the Esplanade
Construction of an overland flow path to relieve trapped floodwaters that collect in a low point in the Esplanande, Wollongong.
Production of locally-customised FloodSafe gudes for 6 flood affected NSW communities (Wollongong, Taree, Wingham, Harrington/Coopernook, Georges River (Sydney), Bathurst, Corowa).
Molongle Creek Drainage Catchment Flood Study
Study to identify, analyse and evaluate the effects of flooding on the Molongle Creek catchment and will involve the development of mitigation options.
Hobart major rivulets flood warning and action plan
Installation of new flood warning system instrumentation and development of flood action plans for Sandy Bay Rivulet, Hobart Rivulet and New Town Rivulet.
Landslide hazard maps of Hobart, Launceston and the northwest coast area between Burnie and Devonport.

Purchase pilot subscription to AGRECON internet-based satellite remote sensing site which will allow Council to determine soil moisture vegetation type and dryness of vegetation, and assist Council to allocate fire mitigation resources. The use of AGRECON forms part of the Council’s Bushfire safe project which is a holistic approach to bushfire mitigation.

Purchase hardware, software and training for the set up of a GIS/GPS system capable of mapping fire related geo-spatial information. This equipment will allow the mapping of asset protection zones on managed land, accessible fire fighting water supplies on managed land, fire trails on public and private land, possible helicopter landing areas as well as the creation of registers for water points, fire trails and asset protection zones on crown and council public land.
Identify, analyse and evaluate flood mitigation options for Terrors Creek to find a preferred scheme to reduce the impact of flooding in Dayboro.
Extreme Flood Event Modelling of the Pine River and Hays Inlet Catchment

Investigate, analyse and assess the effects of extreme flood events on the Pine River and Hays Inlet catchment. Develop flood inundation and risk hazard maps, development controls, emergency planning and flood mitigation strategies as part of this study.

Provide fire trails and asset protection zones in bushland reserves identified as being high and medium hazard. The project will involve identifying hazard bushland reserves, developing reserve fire management plans and creating an asset protection zone register.

Training for Rural Fire Service personnel to deliver and facilitate bushfire community education by each brigade undertaking 2 to 3 street meetings a year at locations identified in the Bush Fire Management Plan.

Provide clear signage for all fire trails and water points on public land areas to increase the safety and efficiency of fire fighting operations and maximise the response of emergency services to fires.
Mt Nebo Evacuation Area and Warning Siren
Investigate the feasibility of providing an evacuation area and siren warning system in Mt Nebo village.
Construction of asset protection zones in high risk areas including the eastern escarpment of Queanbeyan and Mount Jerrabomberra to enhance the safety of residents in these areas.
Detailed community vulnerability assessment of the urban and semi rural areas surrounding Queanbeyan, rural villages of Bungendore, Captain’s Flat and Braidwood and surrounding rural areas.
Fire Management Plans in Noosa Shire Council coastal bushland reserves
Develop site specific fire management plans for 10 coastal bushland reserves under Council management having the highest bushfire hazard rating.

Produce a database of flood damage curves and link to GIS systems to derive potential flood damage costs for the Shire. This information would contribute to prioritising flood mitigation strategies across the Shire.

Purchase two-dimensional hydraulic modelling software (Water Ride), installation costs, training and data population to undertake analyses arising in the previously approved Maroochy River Flood Study.

Identify locations and install additional rainfall and stream gauges. A central recording system backup for the flood emergency centre which houses the flood monitoring central computer system will also be purchased.
Edward-Wakool Rivers (Deniliquin to Liewah) floodplain risk management study and plan
Floodplain risk management study and plan of the Edward-Wakool Rivers floodplain from Deniliquin to Liewah Station. Includes the towns of Deniliquin, Wakool, Moulamein and Barham.
Department of Infrastructure, Planning and Natural Resources
Standardised addressing of rural properties in the Jerilderie local government area.
Upgrading of the UHF Repeater at Mt Youngal to improve reliability and performance. The UHF Repeater is the only form of common contact in this isolated area of Kosciuszko National Park.
Acquisition of residential land in the Mornington Peninsula National Park
Acquisition of four privately owned lots of land in the Mornington Peninsula National Park that are susceptible to significant wildfire threat.
Bunbury Emergency Risk Management, Planning and Recovery Management Project

Further develop a working Emergency Risk Management planning document to include a wider range of risks and treatment options. A second stage will develop and introduce effective recovery management planning. The project will also have some applicability to neighbouring councils in the Greater Bunbury Area.
Lower Prospect Creek voluntary house raising scheme
Demolition and re-building of two properties in Canley Vale (4 Fraser Road and 11 Mooore Street) subject to flooding from Prospect Creek.
Detailed overland flood hazard and risk study for the suburbs of Canley Vale and Canley Heights.
Bushfire management study of the Meehan Range region including the towns of Risdon Vale and Cambridge.
Floodplain mapping of the Kermandie River at Geeveston.
Shoalhaven coastal hazard studies and management plan
Preparation of detailed coastal hazard studies and management plan for the Shoalhaven coastline.
Development of an emergency risk management plan for the Shoalhaven local government area.
Flood alert system - St Georges Basin
Extension of the Shoalhaven River flood alert system to include St Georges Basin (installation of additional rainfall and river recorders).
Greater Perth and South West Corner
Develop a manual to identify the fuel load of various vegetation types in the northern jarrah forest rural / urban interface, Swan Coastal Plain, Geraldton Sand Plain and the Leuwin Ridge.
Fire and Emergency Services Authority of WA
Disaster mitigation support data - building footprints dataset
Update and validate the Greater Perth buildings footprints dataset.
Establishment of 15 community fire units in Sydney and surrounds to promote community safety and awareness and enable communities to deal with bushfire risk at the local level.
Upgrade the Oodnadatta airport for 24-hour all-weather access (repair runway, seal apron and taxiways, and replace lighting).
Toowoomba Escarpment Bushfire Risk Mitigation Project

Acquisition of land and the construction of fire trails to substantially reduce the threat of wildfire in escarpment bushland parks and adjoining land to provide increased capacity for fire mitigation and containment.
Emergency risk management study of natural hazards in the Castlereagh River Catchment centred on Coonamble.
Audit to confirm both the height and structural adequacy of the Coonamble levee bank.
Addressing of rural properties in Coonamble Shire consistent with Australian standards and the rest of NSW.
Narrabri-Wee Waa floodplain management remedial works investigation
Investigation of works and modifications required for the management of floodwaters in and around Wee Waa.
Department of Infrastructure, Planning and Natural Resources
Emergency risk management study of natural hazards in the Namoi River Catchment centred on Gunnedah.
Rural addressing and geocoding in Wellington
Standardised addressing and geocoding of rural properties in the Wellington local government area.
FloodSafe guides - central and north west NSW

Production of locally-customised FloodSafe gudes for 11 flood affected communities of central and north west NSW (Narrabri, Wee Waa, Wellington, Warren, Dubbo, Gunnedah, Quirindi, Manilla, Moree/Pallamallawa, Mungindi and Tamworth).
Upgrade of Special Needs Evacuation Centre for Townsville and Thuringowa

Upgrading of the Assembly Hall of Ignatius Park Christian Brother Secondary College which has been identified as the evacuation centre for residents and staff that may need to be evacuated in a natural disaster event from their beachside Aged Peoples Nursing Home. The works required to the building include the upgrade of the switchboard and other ancillary electrical work so that power can be supplied by a generator, the installation of supermesh screens to windows and the upgrading of power to the kitchen.

Enlarge the Adelaide Airport Drain from May Terrace to West Beach Road and undertake associated works to cater for increased flows in the drain. These works will improve e drainage and reduce flood risk to both upstream and downstream suburbs, and to Adelaide Airport.
Landslide and flood risk and hazard management along the South Coast rail corridor
Improve landslide hazard and risk assessment and management along the South Coast rail corridor through enhanced monitoring and prediction methods.
Wollondilly River and Mulwaree Chain of Ponds flood mitigation measures
Voluntary purchase of flood prone properties in Goulburn.
Building community capacity for flood safety in Maitland and the Hunter Valley
Development of a community education strategy and campaign for Maitland and other flood-affected towns in the Hunter Valley to increase community awareness and understanding of flood risk.
Develoopment of a combined emergency risk management plan for the Cessnock, Dungog, Maitland and Port Stephens local government areas.
FloodSafe guides for the NSW Hunter Valley

Production of locally-customised FloodSafe gudes for 11 flood affected communities in the NSW Hunter Valley (Maitland, Raymond Terrace, Singleton, Denman, Murrurundi, Scone, Muswellbrook, Dungog, Aberdeen, Hexham, Goulburn River).
Fifteen Mile Creek Floodplain Management and Avulsion Management Study (Stage 2)
Floodplain and avulsion management study of Fifteen Mile Creek from Glenrowan to Wangaratta.
Ponton Creek Causeway, Trans Access Road (design only)

Upgrading of the Ponton Creek causeway on the Trans Access Road to minimise future damages and improve access to numerous pastoral stations in the Rawlinna area and the Tjuntjtuntjarra Aboriginal Community.
FESA Indigenous Community Risk Management Officer

Establish a Community Risk Management position to implement the Indigenous Emergency Risk Management Training Package, which will deliver training and complete risk assessments within high risk remote Indigenous communities in the Pilbara and Kimberley.
Fire and Emergency Services Authority of WA
North West Coastal Highway - Robe River flood mitigation works

Reinstate and improve the North West Coastal Highway at Robe River which was severely damaged in March 2004 as a result of tropical cyclone Monty and subsequent flooding. Works include floodway upgrades and road protection works, bridge widening and strengthening.
Nanutarra - Munjina Road. Floodway and bridge damage mitigation works (Gascoyne Region)

The Nanutarra-Munjina Road was damaged by extensive flooding as a result of tropical cyclone Monty in March 2004. Reinstatement works have been completed but improvements are required to prevent similar damage in future events. Works include floodway upgrades and road protection works, reconstruction and upgrading of the Duck Creek and Beasley River bridges.
Construct a purpose built evacuation centre in Onslow.

Fire hazard mapping, mapping of fire tracks and fire breaks, development of a mobile solution for controlled burns and responses to incidents, and the establishment of a central data warehouse for the Atherton Tablelands.
Burke Developmental Road - Trimbles Crossing to Whip Handle

Upgrading of the existing floodway from Whip Handle grid to Trimble’s Crossing (109km west of Chillagoe) which will improve all weather access and reduce the time of closure on the access route into this region during flood events.
Burke Developmental Road - Gilbert River Culverts
Install culverts on a skewed alignment to prevent damage that is currently being caused during flood events.

Supply and install 4 road condition signs at key locations (3 at Charters Towers and 1 at Townsville). These signs will provide information to motorists so they can make informed decisions with regard to travel plans. Information displayed will include road closures and load restrictions.
North Qld Strategy Report into a Natural Disaster Mitigation Program
Study major Gulf and Peninsula roads to identify low lying sections subject to frequent inundation, and to develop, cost and prioritise cost effective remedial works.
Peninsula Developmental Road - Carroll Creek crossing

Replace the existing bed level crossing and steep approaches at Carroll Creek (16kms south of Musgrave) with a higher level drainage structure. This will improve all weather access and reduce the time of closure on the only road access route into this Queensland region.
Peninsula Developmental Road - Unnamed Creek crossing (Ch149.6 km)

Replace the existing bed level crossing and steep approaches at Unnamed Creek (10.7kms south of Musgrave) with a higher level drainage structure. This will improve all weather access and reduce the time of closure on the only road access route into this Queensland region.
Peninsula Developmental Road - Red Blanket Creek crossing

Replace the existing bed level crossing and steep approaches at Red Blanket Creek (12.1kms south of Musgrave) with a higher level drainage structure. This will improve all weather access and reduce the time of closure on the only road access route into this Queensland region.
Peninsula Developmental Road - 10 Mile Creek crossing

Replace the existing bed level crossing and steep approaches at 10 Mile Creek (16kms north of Musgrave) with a higher level drainage structure. This will improve all weather access and reduce the time of closure on the only road access route into this Queensland region.
Floodplain terrain modelling of the Greater Taree area using airborne laser scanning.
Wrights Creek flood study and management plan
Detailed flood study and management plan for Wrights Creek, Port Macquarie.
Improved flood access for Dunbogan - feasibility study
Feasibility study, preliminary design and analysis of two options to improve road access to and from Dunbogan during flooding (ie. raise existing road or construct an alternate access route).
Establishment of flood markers in Camden Haven to raise community awareness and improve flood warning.
Rock armouring protection works on a bend of the George River north of St Helens.
Feasibility study to consider options for an alternative access route to the Bushy Park community during times of water inundation of the Styx River Bridge and its approach roads.
Construction of a detention basin at Avalon Golf Course near The Crescent to reduce effects of Careel Creek flooding on Avalon shops and downstream residences.
Howell Close detention basin and North Arm flood bypass

Investigation and feasibility of flood protection works within the Newport Beach catchment. Works include a detention basin near Howell Close, flood bypass tunnel and improvements to flowpaths along North Arm.
Flood education and awareness programme for the Pittwater local government area focussing on the Newport Beach catchment.
South Creek flood plain risk management study and plan
Preparation of a floodplain risk management study and plan for South Creek, Cromer.

Preparation of fire regime management plans for 7 bushland reserves (Allenby Park, Beacon Hill; Dee Why Lagoon Wildlife Refuge; Jamieson Park, Narrabeen; Manly Dam, Manly Vale; JJ Melbourne Hills Memorial Reserve; Forestville Park, Forestville; Anembo Reserve, Duffys Forest).
Erosion of Burke River Bank (Bedourie-Boulia Road)
Study into the river system and methods of management for the prevention and control of erosion and the construction of erosion control structures.
Diamantina Developmental Road - Quilpie-Windorah Flood Mitigation

Installation of concrete margins on the downstream side of the road on flood prone sections and on the upstream and downstream sides of floodways, bridges and culverts which are more prone to higher velocity and quantities of water near the major waterways.
Diamantina Developmental Road - Lower Limestone Creek culverts
Add additional culvert cells and raise the road embankment level by approximately one metre, 8.1-8.8 km north of Boulia, to improve flood immunity and trafficability.
Department of Main Roads (inconjunction with Boulia Shire)
Upper Onkaparinga Flood Risk Assessment and Strategic Options Study
Following on from the Upper Onkaparinga Floodplain Mapping Study, undertake detailed flood risk assessments, and develop strategic treatment options.

Creation of bushfire incident control lines in Excelsior Reserve (Bidjigal), Fred Caterson Reserve, Hunts Creek Reserve, Glenhaven corridors and Toongabbie Creek corridors to offer protection to homes, community facilities and infrastructure bordering on these reserves.
Flood Safe: Building Support of the Local Council and Community
Flood awareness programme for residents of central western Sydney including Baulkham Hills, Blacktown, Holroyd and Parramatta.
Relocation of levees that are causing hydraulic constriciton and/or are too close to the river banks.
Floodplain management study of Numurkah township.
Torrumbarry Gunbower floodplain risk management study
Floodplain risk management study of the River Murray between Torrumbarry and Gunbower.
Remodelling of the Peel River floodplain to provide a more accurate picture of the floodplain following the construction of several mitigation measures.
Tamworth flood warning system - ALERT upgrade
Upgrade of the Tamworth flood warning system to an ALERT system (installation of software and radio telemetry).
Installation of an additional river station on the Cockburn River at Kootingal.
Nundle flood and floodplain risk management study
Preparation of a flood and floodplain risk management study of Nundle for the future development of a floodplain risk management plan.
Woolomin village flood and floodplain risk management study
Preparation of a flood and floodplain risk management study of Woolomin village for the future development of a floodplain risk management plan.
NSW Flood Database (Stage 1 - feasibility and scoping study)
Feasibility and scopying study to determine the most appropriate and cost effective GIS based flood database system for NSW.
Department of Infrastructure, Planning and Natural Resources
NSW Coastal Hazard Definition Database (Stage 1 - archive and preparation of electronic database)
Development of a consolidated electronic database containing coastal hazard data for NSW.
Department of Infrastructure, Planning and Natural Resources
Many Languages - disaster recovery information for culturally and linguistically diverse communities
Translation of existing English language brochures detailing disaster recovery services in NSW into Arabic, Chinese, Croatian, Macedonian, Turkish and Vietnamese.
Emergency management defensive and evacuation planning for animal holding establishments
Production of a guide to assist animal holding establishments such as veterinary clinics, horse studs, boarding kennels and catteries develop defensive and evacuation plans.
Enhancement of the Bushfire Risk Information Management System (BRIMS) to include a fire trail register.
Bushfire hazard and risk assessment methodology study
Research and development of an enhanced methodology for bushfire hazard and risk assessment.

Further development of an enhanced flood intelligence system to improve the understanding and effectiveness of flood warning predictions - Statewide extension of a pilot programme conducted in the Georges River Valley.
Development of guidelines for landslide hazard zoning and management and maintenance of properties subject to landslide hazard.
AGS Landslide Risk Management Practice Note
Development of guidelines (practice note) for landslide risk assessment and management of proposed development in landslide prone areas.
Emergency response plans for hobby farmers and rural residential landholders

Development of local emergency response plans for communities of hobby farmers and rural residential landholders (pilot programme in the North Coast, South Coast, Hunter, Western Sydney and Southern Sydney/Southern Highlands regions).
Identify, analyse and evaluate the risks to the community associated with flooding in Wagin township, and develop a Flood Management Plan.

Conduct the 2004 Bushfire Build Safe Seminar in Denmark. The seminar is intended to increase knowledge about building requirements and standards in bushfire prone areas and encourage better building design and location.
Ipswich City Council - Enhancement of GIS for Natural Disaster Management

Expansion of the Council’s GIS to include disaster management issues. This will involve adding records of the current Counter Disaster Committee and the new Local Disaster Management Group to the GIS. These will include the locations and capability of all emergency response resources, community resources and records of jobs undertaken in response to natural disaster events.
Ipswich City Council - Preparation of Local Disaster Management Plan

Prepare the Ipswich Disaster Mitigation Plan, incorporating a number of the disaster mitigation and preparedness treatment strategies contained within the Ipswich Natural Disaster Mitigation Plan, as well as reviewing the operational components of the current Ipswich Counter Disaster Plan.
Ipswich City Council - Gravel Road Upgrade

Upgrade two sections of gravel road which have suffered significant damage on a recurring basis as trial projects. The proposed treatments will comprise various forms of protection to the downstream face of road embankment and other ancillary works to reduce overtopping impacts. The two locations will enable subsequent decisions to be made about the most cost effective treatment and its wider application throughout the City.

Purchase of hardware and software to capture information from the Bureau of Meteorology’s (BOM) ALERT warning stations together with real time data verification, and develop a flood forecasting model based on the existing RAFTS hydrological model. This information will allow more detailed and earlier information regarding flood forecasting than is possible from the BOM warnings alone in order to assist with decisions as to activation of the Local Disaster Plan.
Coastal zone management study and plan
Preparation of a management plan to address the threat of coastal erosion caused by severe storms and cyclones to communities at Lennox Head and Patches Beach.
Rehabilitation of the Ardent Street drain outlet to ensure the integrity of the South Grafton levee system.
Development of an emergency risk management plan for the Lismore local government area (including villages, urban areas and rural land sharing communities).
Identification and mapping of high risk flood affected rural areas in the Richmond River floodplain. Includes incorporation of data into a GIS system.
Development of an emergency risk management plan for the Richmond Valley local government area.

Implementation of mitigation measures identified in the Casino and Mid Richmond floodplain risk management study and plans. Includes flood warning, emergency planning and community awareness programmess for Casino, Coraki, Woodburn, Rileys Hill and Broadwater.
Emergency risk management study of natural hazards in the Central Darling local government area. Includes the towns of Wilcannia, Menindee, Ivanhoe and White Cliffs.
Emergency risk management study of natural hazards in the Macquarie River Catchment centred on Dubbo.
Aerial photographs of the Forbes local government area for inclusion into Council’s GIS mapping system improving the management of future flood events.
Rural flood study of the Lachlan River at Condobolin
Detailed flood study of the rural areas surrounding Condobolin affected by flooding from the Lachlan River.
Emergency risk management study of natural hazards in the Macquarie River Catchment centred on Narromine.
Toongabbie Creek flood mitigation works (Briens Road Culvert)
Culvert modifications to improve the waterway capacity of Toongabbie Creek at Briens Road.
Voluntary purchase of 2 properties in Wentworthville subject to flooding from Toongabbie Creek.
Installation of a new ALERT river station on the Myall River upstream from Bulahdelah.
Installation of an additional water level recorder on Wallis Lake to obtain true representation of wind/wave climate on lake.
Emergency risk management study and disaster mitigation strategy
Comprehensive emergency risk management study and disaster mitigation strategy for the Great Lakes, Greater Taree and Gloucester region.
Emergency Services directories for the Peel East, Avon South, South West Corner and Albany regions

Create Emergency Services directories for the Peel East, Avon South, South West Corner and Albany regions of WA. Information includes topographic, cadastral and hydrographic data, power transmission lines, water and gas pipelines, roads and transmission towers, etc.
Undertake a multi-hazard risk assessment of the LeFevre Peninsula.
Constructi an off-take weir and associated works to complete the Little Para River overflow channel.
Enlarge and upgrade the Parafield Airport west drain to improve flow capacity and reduce flooding in the surrounding area.

Evaluate issues impacting on residential dwellings in high fire risk areas. A Fire Risk Mitigation Guide will be developed as a result of this research and will be supplied to the Housing Industry and consumers in a Web format to direct the building orientation and construction of the dwelling giving consideration to local site characteristics to minimise bushfire impacts.
Scoping Study for a Cyclone Shelter Program

Identify public and private buildings in all areas prone to cyclonic weather which are suitable and code compliant (or can be upgraded) to be used to temporarily house community members during cyclonic conditions. The project will also include investigating the costs associated with the potential construction of new buildings and the development of a strategy and implementation plan for the provision of cyclone shelters.
LGAQ Disaster Management, Capability Development and Implementation Project

Conduct a study as a means to increase the capacity of Local Government to respond to corporate planning, risk assessment and disaster mitigation. The project will focus on the development of resources and tools shifting the paradigm from response to include strategic planning for disasters and the development of frameworks for ensuring priority risks are assessed and funded for the best social and economic outcomes.
Local Government Storm Tide Mapping Project

Produce purpose designed storm tide emergency management maps to a common standard for all Queensland coastal communities with a storm tide risk. These maps are essential to effectively prepare communities for, and manage, evacuations.
South East Queensland Disaster Communications Project: Promoting Safe, Sustainable Communities

Develop and implement a strategic framework to support regionally consistent educational and early warning strategies for disaster-prone communities. It will include the incorporation of the needs of all key providers and spheres of government and will address all phases of a disaster from planning and preparation to response and recovery.
Cape Byron Sand Lobe - sand extraction feasibility study

Scoping study to assess the feasibility of extracting sand from the Cape Byron Sand Lobe to protect beachfront property, private dwellings and public infrastructure at Byron Bay-Belongil and New Brighton from coastal erosion caused by storm events.
Tweed Valley community flood awareness programme
Flood awareness programme for residents of the Tweed Valley. Includes a media campaign, installation of flood markers and preparation of pamphlets and web site.
Design of a levee system to protect Hillston from flooding of the Lachlan River.
Flood study of Ardlethan township and surrounding areas.
Wagga Wagga levee and river bank rehabilitation works
Levee and river bank rehabilitation works along the Murrumbidgee River between Small Street and the Wagga Wagga Tourist Information Centre to stabilise the levee and prevent failure or collapse.
Eastern Industrial levee - feasibility and environmental assessment
Study to assess the feasibility and environmental impact of the construction of Eastern Industrial levee.
Installation of up to 14 automatic rainfall stations throughout the Gosford City area from Wamberal in the north to Patonga in the south.
Terrigal Grassland Avenue Catchment flood mitigation works
Flood mitigation works to improve flood protection for 18 residential dwellings in Grassland Avenue and surrounding streets.
Voluntary purchase and demolition of 1 property in Gosford (162 Showground Road) subject to flooding from Narara Creek.
Digital Elevation Model for South Australia
Develop a state wide high resolution Digital Elevation Model to assist in identifying and modelling risks to communities.
Undertake a feasibility study to investigate options for a mobile stock disposal system that can be employed at any site in the State after a natural disaster.
Primary Industries and Resources South Australia
Conduct a one-day seminar in Adelaide involving a broad cross section of community safety facilitators in South Australia to develop community facilitation and engagement techniques.
SA Fire and Emergency Services Commission
Flood Awareness, Flood Warning and Response in South Australia
Review and update the 5-Year Flood Warning Development Plan and prioritise required improvements.
South Australian Flood Warning Consultative Committee
Upgrading of existing Bailey Bridge stock and purchase of additional components to provide temporary crossings when permanent bridges are lost due to flood or bushfire.
Department of Infrastructure, Energy and Resources
Disaster Alert - community warning and information web site
Development of a natural disaster hazard website providing Tasmanian’s with up to date information about current events (nature, severity, geographical location, road closures, etc).
Department of Police and Public Safety
Engaging the Community - Floods and You
Statewide strategy to improve community awareness and preparedness for floods. Focuses on high flood risk areas of the State.
Forging Links - Emergency Management and Local Government
Printing and distribution of the Forging Links - Emergency Management and Local Government information kit to all local governments in the State.
Tasmanian State Emergency Service and Local Govt Assoc of Tasmania
Victorian Flood Data dataset infill project
Updating of the Victorian Flood Data dataset to include details of recently completed flood related studies.
Development of a community education and engagement strategy for bushfire management.

Three-year project to upgrade some 4,800 kms of critical roads and tracks in parks and forests for use in fire prevention and fire management activities. The project will target roads in the State’s highest bushfire risk areas - Otways, Dandenongs and Macedon area.
Flood risk review for Victorian caravan parks
Study to identify all caravan/camping parks at risk from flooding in Victoria and develop approaches, including appropriate planning controls, to mitigate the effects of flooding in such areas.
Adams Creek/Edinburgh Parks Flood Mitigation Dams
Construct flood mitigation dams in Adams Creek adjacent to Gooronga Drive and Turner Drive, Edinburgh Parks.
Flood and Fire Mitigation in Goyder

Conduct one bushfire and two flood risk assessment studies (Council-wide and at Burra), develop a flood data base to identify vulnerable properties, and undertake channel improvement works in Eudunda.
Floodplain management plan for Russel Creek and Merri River
Preparation of a floodplain managagement plan for Russel Creek and the Merri River at North Warrnambool.
Implementation of high priority mitigation measures addressing coastal hazards in the Manly local government area.
Geotechnical survey of public lands affected by coastal hazards
Detailed geotechnical assessment of coastal hazards in the Manly local government area to determine suitable management strategies.
Real-time burnt area and flood mapping
Undertake satellite mapping of flooded or burnt areas across Australia for improved emergency management.
Remote sensing technologies for flood risk management
Undertake scoping study to examine and prototype the application of remote sensing technologies to complement existing flood monitoring and warning systems.
Establish direct access to key spatial information in a readaily accessible form from various sources across government for emergency mitigation.
Towards a National Bushfire Warning and Management System

Undertake scoping and costing for the establishment of a national system to access digital spatial information data to facilitate bushfire mitigation and response. The project will initially provide a single point of access to the currently available different operational systems but ultimately unify these systems to create a more robust, national-scale operational system able to deal with large, national emergencies and associated high demand for information based on near real-time satellite observations.
Profiling of bushfire arsonists in Western Australia
Research into the profile of bushfire arsonists to improve community targeted arson reduction activities.
Fire and Emergency Services Authority of WA
Enhance the ‘Planning for Bushfire Protection’ land development and bushfire protection guide, and identification of building protection zone dimensions.
Fire and Emergency Services Authority of WA

quote.para: Attachment B

entry.para: Augmentation of two low points in the Kelso levee to provide protection for up to 275 homes in the Panania area from Georges River flooding.
Undertake a pilot project in the Riverland to develop an implementation strategy for standardised addressing of all rural properties in South Australia.
Department of Administrative and Information Services
Conduct a disaster risk assessment and treatment study of all 15 local councils within the Central Local Government Region.
Central Local Government Region of South Australia
North Esk River flood warning and data acquisition system
Installation of telemetered river gauges on the North Esk River at Launceston.
Construction of a detention basin at Deverall Park to reduce flooding in the surrounding area near Milperra Road.
Mitcham Council Bushfire Risk Assessment Study
Conduct a bushfire risk assessment study and develop a community education strategy and works program for the Mitcham Fire Prone Area.
Lower Forth flood evacuation plan implementation measures
Identification of a 1:100 AEP for the Lower Forth Valley (including Forth, Leith, Turners Beach and Ulverstone) and accompanying education programme and evacuation plan.
Construct rock armoured headlands and undertake sand nourishment to address beach erosion at Kwinana Beach.
Capturing Small Landholdings Information for Disaster Mitigation and Management

Integrate the Client and Resource Information System and the Rural Street Addressing databases for small landholdings in 12 council areas on Perth’s fringe to improve their quality and effectiveness, so as to facilitate their use in disaster disaster mitigation, response and recovery.
Brisbane Valley Flood Drainage Minimisation Study

Collaborative regional project that will involve undertaking a flood study of the Brisbane River catchment area. This study provides an ideal opportunity for Federal, State and Local Governments and SEQ Water to work together to optimise the operations of dams so that the significant damage that can occur from flood events is minimised.
Flood study of the Greater Dandenong municipality.

Preparation of disaster risk management plans for each local government area within CENTROC (Bathurst Regional, Blayney, Cabonne, Cowra, Lachlan, Lithgow, Forbes, Mid Western, Oberon, Orange, Parkes, Weddin, Wellington).

Replacement of the existing lower level timber bridge at Kianga Creek with a 130 metre long concrete bridge providing two traffic lanes and associated approach roadworks. This will mean that the Moura community will not be isolated except in extreme flooding events significantly beyond a once in 50 year flood event.
Identify, analyse and evaluate the impact of flood events on the township of Alpha and will investigate the costs and benefits of various mitigation options.
Resurface the existing crossing at Southern Cross Floodway to increase the crossings resilience to water inundation from flooding.
Construct earth levees upstream to channel floodwaters to the creek and to culverts to allow the road at May Creek to withstand scouring by floodwaters and still remain passable.
Community and Fire Safety education days
Conduct Community and Fire Safety education days in Emerald Valley, Carabooda and Seatrees Estate, Two Rocks to raise community awareness about bushfires.
Flood study of the Upper Kalang River including Brierfield, Sunny Corner, Scotchman, Kooroowi and Kalang.
Flood hazard and risk study for Dorrigo township.
Establishment of asset protection zones along the urban - bushland interface of the Wollongong local government area.
Towradgi Creek - footbridge at Coolong Crescent
Raising of the Coolong Crescent footbridge in Wollongong to increase the waterway capacity and reduce flood levels upstream.
Hewitts Creek - sediment basin at Hobart Street
Construction of a sediment basin at Hobart Street, Wollongong to prevent culverts and bridges becoming blocked with debris during floods.
Hewitts Creek - flow path at the Esplanade
Construction of an overland flow path to relieve trapped floodwaters that collect in a low point in the Esplanande, Wollongong.
Production of locally-customised FloodSafe gudes for 6 flood affected NSW communities (Wollongong, Taree, Wingham, Harrington/Coopernook, Georges River (Sydney), Bathurst, Corowa).
Molongle Creek Drainage Catchment Flood Study
Study to identify, analyse and evaluate the effects of flooding on the Molongle Creek catchment and will involve the development of mitigation options.
Hobart major rivulets flood warning and action plan
Installation of new flood warning system instrumentation and development of flood action plans for Sandy Bay Rivulet, Hobart Rivulet and New Town Rivulet.
Landslide hazard maps of Hobart, Launceston and the northwest coast area between Burnie and Devonport.

Purchase pilot subscription to AGRECON internet-based satellite remote sensing site which will allow Council to determine soil moisture vegetation type and dryness of vegetation, and assist Council to allocate fire mitigation resources. The use of AGRECON forms part of the Council’s Bushfire safe project which is a holistic approach to bushfire mitigation.

Purchase hardware, software and training for the set up of a GIS/GPS system capable of mapping fire related geo-spatial information. This equipment will allow the mapping of asset protection zones on managed land, accessible fire fighting water supplies on managed land, fire trails on public and private land, possible helicopter landing areas as well as the creation of registers for water points, fire trails and asset protection zones on crown and council public land.
Identify, analyse and evaluate flood mitigation options for Terrors Creek to find a preferred scheme to reduce the impact of flooding in Dayboro.
Extreme Flood Event Modelling of the Pine River and Hays Inlet Catchment

Investigate, analyse and assess the effects of extreme flood events on the Pine River and Hays Inlet catchment. Develop flood inundation and risk hazard maps, development controls, emergency planning and flood mitigation strategies as part of this study.

Provide fire trails and asset protection zones in bushland reserves identified as being high and medium hazard. The project will involve identifying hazard bushland reserves, developing reserve fire management plans and creating an asset protection zone register.

Training for Rural Fire Service personnel to deliver and facilitate bushfire community education by each brigade undertaking 2 to 3 street meetings a year at locations identified in the Bush Fire Management Plan.

Provide clear signage for all fire trails and water points on public land areas to increase the safety and efficiency of fire fighting operations and maximise the response of emergency services to fires.
Mt Nebo Evacuation Area and Warning Siren
Investigate the feasibility of providing an evacuation area and siren warning system in Mt Nebo village.
Construction of asset protection zones in high risk areas including the eastern escarpment of Queanbeyan and Mount Jerrabomberra to enhance the safety of residents in these areas.
Detailed community vulnerability assessment of the urban and semi rural areas surrounding Queanbeyan, rural villages of Bungendore, Captain’s Flat and Braidwood and surrounding rural areas.
Fire Management Plans in Noosa Shire Council coastal bushland reserves
Develop site specific fire management plans for 10 coastal bushland reserves under Council management having the highest bushfire hazard rating.

Produce a database of flood damage curves and link to GIS systems to derive potential flood damage costs for the Shire. This information would contribute to prioritising flood mitigation strategies across the Shire.

Purchase two-dimensional hydraulic modelling software (Water Ride), installation costs, training and data population to undertake analyses arising in the previously approved Maroochy River Flood Study.

Identify locations and install additional rainfall and stream gauges. A central recording system backup for the flood emergency centre which houses the flood monitoring central computer system will also be purchased.
Edward-Wakool Rivers (Deniliquin to Liewah) floodplain risk management study and plan
Floodplain risk management study and plan of the Edward-Wakool Rivers floodplain from Deniliquin to Liewah Station. Includes the towns of Deniliquin, Wakool, Moulamein and Barham.
Department of Infrastructure, Planning and Natural Resources
Standardised addressing of rural properties in the Jerilderie local government area.
Upgrading of the UHF Repeater at Mt Youngal to improve reliability and performance. The UHF Repeater is the only form of common contact in this isolated area of Kosciuszko National Park.
Acquisition of residential land in the Mornington Peninsula National Park
Acquisition of four privately owned lots of land in the Mornington Peninsula National Park that are susceptible to significant wildfire threat.
Bunbury Emergency Risk Management, Planning and Recovery Management Project

Further develop a working Emergency Risk Management planning document to include a wider range of risks and treatment options. A second stage will develop and introduce effective recovery management planning. The project will also have some applicability to neighbouring councils in the Greater Bunbury Area.
Lower Prospect Creek voluntary house raising scheme
Demolition and re-building of two properties in Canley Vale (4 Fraser Road and 11 Mooore Street) subject to flooding from Prospect Creek.
Detailed overland flood hazard and risk study for the suburbs of Canley Vale and Canley Heights.
Bushfire management study of the Meehan Range region including the towns of Risdon Vale and Cambridge.
Floodplain mapping of the Kermandie River at Geeveston.
Shoalhaven coastal hazard studies and management plan
Preparation of detailed coastal hazard studies and management plan for the Shoalhaven coastline.
Development of an emergency risk management plan for the Shoalhaven local government area.
Flood alert system - St Georges Basin
Extension of the Shoalhaven River flood alert system to include St Georges Basin (installation of additional rainfall and river recorders).
Greater Perth and South West Corner
Develop a manual to identify the fuel load of various vegetation types in the northern jarrah forest rural / urban interface, Swan Coastal Plain, Geraldton Sand Plain and the Leuwin Ridge.
Fire and Emergency Services Authority of WA
Disaster mitigation support data - building footprints dataset
Update and validate the Greater Perth buildings footprints dataset.
Establishment of 15 community fire units in Sydney and surrounds to promote community safety and awareness and enable communities to deal with bushfire risk at the local level.
Upgrade the Oodnadatta airport for 24-hour all-weather access (repair runway, seal apron and taxiways, and replace lighting).
Toowoomba Escarpment Bushfire Risk Mitigation Project

Acquisition of land and the construction of fire trails to substantially reduce the threat of wildfire in escarpment bushland parks and adjoining land to provide increased capacity for fire mitigation and containment.
Emergency risk management study of natural hazards in the Castlereagh River Catchment centred on Coonamble.
Audit to confirm both the height and structural adequacy of the Coonamble levee bank.
Addressing of rural properties in Coonamble Shire consistent with Australian standards and the rest of NSW.
Narrabri-Wee Waa floodplain management remedial works investigation
Investigation of works and modifications required for the management of floodwaters in and around Wee Waa.
Department of Infrastructure, Planning and Natural Resources
Emergency risk management study of natural hazards in the Namoi River Catchment centred on Gunnedah.
Rural addressing and geocoding in Wellington
Standardised addressing and geocoding of rural properties in the Wellington local government area.
FloodSafe guides - central and north west NSW

Production of locally-customised FloodSafe gudes for 11 flood affected communities of central and north west NSW (Narrabri, Wee Waa, Wellington, Warren, Dubbo, Gunnedah, Quirindi, Manilla, Moree/Pallamallawa, Mungindi and Tamworth).
Upgrade of Special Needs Evacuation Centre for Townsville and Thuringowa

Upgrading of the Assembly Hall of Ignatius Park Christian Brother Secondary College which has been identified as the evacuation centre for residents and staff that may need to be evacuated in a natural disaster event from their beachside Aged Peoples Nursing Home. The works required to the building include the upgrade of the switchboard and other ancillary electrical work so that power can be supplied by a generator, the installation of supermesh screens to windows and the upgrading of power to the kitchen.

Enlarge the Adelaide Airport Drain from May Terrace to West Beach Road and undertake associated works to cater for increased flows in the drain. These works will improve e drainage and reduce flood risk to both upstream and downstream suburbs, and to Adelaide Airport.
Landslide and flood risk and hazard management along the South Coast rail corridor
Improve landslide hazard and risk assessment and management along the South Coast rail corridor through enhanced monitoring and prediction methods.
Wollondilly River and Mulwaree Chain of Ponds flood mitigation measures
Voluntary purchase of flood prone properties in Goulburn.
Building community capacity for flood safety in Maitland and the Hunter Valley
Development of a community education strategy and campaign for Maitland and other flood-affected towns in the Hunter Valley to increase community awareness and understanding of flood risk.
Develoopment of a combined emergency risk management plan for the Cessnock, Dungog, Maitland and Port Stephens local government areas.
FloodSafe guides for the NSW Hunter Valley

Production of locally-customised FloodSafe gudes for 11 flood affected communities in the NSW Hunter Valley (Maitland, Raymond Terrace, Singleton, Denman, Murrurundi, Scone, Muswellbrook, Dungog, Aberdeen, Hexham, Goulburn River).
Fifteen Mile Creek Floodplain Management and Avulsion Management Study (Stage 2)
Floodplain and avulsion management study of Fifteen Mile Creek from Glenrowan to Wangaratta.
Ponton Creek Causeway, Trans Access Road (design only)

Upgrading of the Ponton Creek causeway on the Trans Access Road to minimise future damages and improve access to numerous pastoral stations in the Rawlinna area and the Tjuntjtuntjarra Aboriginal Community.
FESA Indigenous Community Risk Management Officer

Establish a Community Risk Management position to implement the Indigenous Emergency Risk Management Training Package, which will deliver training and complete risk assessments within high risk remote Indigenous communities in the Pilbara and Kimberley.
Fire and Emergency Services Authority of WA
North West Coastal Highway - Robe River flood mitigation works

Reinstate and improve the North West Coastal Highway at Robe River which was severely damaged in March 2004 as a result of tropical cyclone Monty and subsequent flooding. Works include floodway upgrades and road protection works, bridge widening and strengthening.
Nanutarra - Munjina Road. Floodway and bridge damage mitigation works (Gascoyne Region)

The Nanutarra-Munjina Road was damaged by extensive flooding as a result of tropical cyclone Monty in March 2004. Reinstatement works have been completed but improvements are required to prevent similar damage in future events. Works include floodway upgrades and road protection works, reconstruction and upgrading of the Duck Creek and Beasley River bridges.
Construct a purpose built evacuation centre in Onslow.

Fire hazard mapping, mapping of fire tracks and fire breaks, development of a mobile solution for controlled burns and responses to incidents, and the establishment of a central data warehouse for the Atherton Tablelands.
Burke Developmental Road - Trimbles Crossing to Whip Handle

Upgrading of the existing floodway from Whip Handle grid to Trimble’s Crossing (109km west of Chillagoe) which will improve all weather access and reduce the time of closure on the access route into this region during flood events.
Burke Developmental Road - Gilbert River Culverts
Install culverts on a skewed alignment to prevent damage that is currently being caused during flood events.

Supply and install 4 road condition signs at key locations (3 at Charters Towers and 1 at Townsville). These signs will provide information to motorists so they can make informed decisions with regard to travel plans. Information displayed will include road closures and load restrictions.
North Qld Strategy Report into a Natural Disaster Mitigation Program
Study major Gulf and Peninsula roads to identify low lying sections subject to frequent inundation, and to develop, cost and prioritise cost effective remedial works.
Peninsula Developmental Road - Carroll Creek crossing

Replace the existing bed level crossing and steep approaches at Carroll Creek (16kms south of Musgrave) with a higher level drainage structure. This will improve all weather access and reduce the time of closure on the only road access route into this Queensland region.
Peninsula Developmental Road - Unnamed Creek crossing (Ch149.6 km)

Replace the existing bed level crossing and steep approaches at Unnamed Creek (10.7kms south of Musgrave) with a higher level drainage structure. This will improve all weather access and reduce the time of closure on the only road access route into this Queensland region.
Peninsula Developmental Road - Red Blanket Creek crossing

Replace the existing bed level crossing and steep approaches at Red Blanket Creek (12.1kms south of Musgrave) with a higher level drainage structure. This will improve all weather access and reduce the time of closure on the only road access route into this Queensland region.
Peninsula Developmental Road - 10 Mile Creek crossing

Replace the existing bed level crossing and steep approaches at 10 Mile Creek (16kms north of Musgrave) with a higher level drainage structure. This will improve all weather access and reduce the time of closure on the only road access route into this Queensland region.
Floodplain terrain modelling of the Greater Taree area using airborne laser scanning.
Wrights Creek flood study and management plan
Detailed flood study and management plan for Wrights Creek, Port Macquarie.
Improved flood access for Dunbogan - feasibility study
Feasibility study, preliminary design and analysis of two options to improve road access to and from Dunbogan during flooding (ie. raise existing road or construct an alternate access route).
Establishment of flood markers in Camden Haven to raise community awareness and improve flood warning.
Rock armouring protection works on a bend of the George River north of St Helens.
Feasibility study to consider options for an alternative access route to the Bushy Park community during times of water inundation of the Styx River Bridge and its approach roads.
Construction of a detention basin at Avalon Golf Course near The Crescent to reduce effects of Careel Creek flooding on Avalon shops and downstream residences.
Howell Close detention basin and North Arm flood bypass

Investigation and feasibility of flood protection works within the Newport Beach catchment. Works include a detention basin near Howell Close, flood bypass tunnel and improvements to flowpaths along North Arm.
Flood education and awareness programme for the Pittwater local government area focussing on the Newport Beach catchment.
South Creek flood plain risk management study and plan
Preparation of a floodplain risk management study and plan for South Creek, Cromer.

Preparation of fire regime management plans for 7 bushland reserves (Allenby Park, Beacon Hill; Dee Why Lagoon Wildlife Refuge; Jamieson Park, Narrabeen; Manly Dam, Manly Vale; JJ Melbourne Hills Memorial Reserve; Forestville Park, Forestville; Anembo Reserve, Duffys Forest).
Erosion of Burke River Bank (Bedourie-Boulia Road)
Study into the river system and methods of management for the prevention and control of erosion and the construction of erosion control structures.
Diamantina Developmental Road - Quilpie-Windorah Flood Mitigation

Installation of concrete margins on the downstream side of the road on flood prone sections and on the upstream and downstream sides of floodways, bridges and culverts which are more prone to higher velocity and quantities of water near the major waterways.
Diamantina Developmental Road - Lower Limestone Creek culverts
Add additional culvert cells and raise the road embankment level by approximately one metre, 8.1-8.8 km north of Boulia, to improve flood immunity and trafficability.
Department of Main Roads (inconjunction with Boulia Shire)
Upper Onkaparinga Flood Risk Assessment and Strategic Options Study
Following on from the Upper Onkaparinga Floodplain Mapping Study, undertake detailed flood risk assessments, and develop strategic treatment options.

Creation of bushfire incident control lines in Excelsior Reserve (Bidjigal), Fred Caterson Reserve, Hunts Creek Reserve, Glenhaven corridors and Toongabbie Creek corridors to offer protection to homes, community facilities and infrastructure bordering on these reserves.
Flood Safe: Building Support of the Local Council and Community
Flood awareness programme for residents of central western Sydney including Baulkham Hills, Blacktown, Holroyd and Parramatta.
Relocation of levees that are causing hydraulic constriciton and/or are too close to the river banks.
Floodplain management study of Numurkah township.
Torrumbarry Gunbower floodplain risk management study
Floodplain risk management study of the River Murray between Torrumbarry and Gunbower.
Remodelling of the Peel River floodplain to provide a more accurate picture of the floodplain following the construction of several mitigation measures.
Tamworth flood warning system - ALERT upgrade
Upgrade of the Tamworth flood warning system to an ALERT system (installation of software and radio telemetry).
Installation of an additional river station on the Cockburn River at Kootingal.
Nundle flood and floodplain risk management study
Preparation of a flood and floodplain risk management study of Nundle for the future development of a floodplain risk management plan.
Woolomin village flood and floodplain risk management study
Preparation of a flood and floodplain risk management study of Woolomin village for the future development of a floodplain risk management plan.
NSW Flood Database (Stage 1 - feasibility and scoping study)
Feasibility and scopying study to determine the most appropriate and cost effective GIS based flood database system for NSW.
Department of Infrastructure, Planning and Natural Resources
NSW Coastal Hazard Definition Database (Stage 1 - archive and preparation of electronic database)
Development of a consolidated electronic database containing coastal hazard data for NSW.
Department of Infrastructure, Planning and Natural Resources
Many Languages - disaster recovery information for culturally and linguistically diverse communities
Translation of existing English language brochures detailing disaster recovery services in NSW into Arabic, Chinese, Croatian, Macedonian, Turkish and Vietnamese.
Emergency management defensive and evacuation planning for animal holding establishments
Production of a guide to assist animal holding establishments such as veterinary clinics, horse studs, boarding kennels and catteries develop defensive and evacuation plans.
Enhancement of the Bushfire Risk Information Management System (BRIMS) to include a fire trail register.
Bushfire hazard and risk assessment methodology study
Research and development of an enhanced methodology for bushfire hazard and risk assessment.

Further development of an enhanced flood intelligence system to improve the understanding and effectiveness of flood warning predictions - Statewide extension of a pilot programme conducted in the Georges River Valley.
Development of guidelines for landslide hazard zoning and management and maintenance of properties subject to landslide hazard.
AGS Landslide Risk Management Practice Note
Development of guidelines (practice note) for landslide risk assessment and management of proposed development in landslide prone areas.
Emergency response plans for hobby farmers and rural residential landholders

Development of local emergency response plans for communities of hobby farmers and rural residential landholders (pilot programme in the North Coast, South Coast, Hunter, Western Sydney and Southern Sydney/Southern Highlands regions).
Identify, analyse and evaluate the risks to the community associated with flooding in Wagin township, and develop a Flood Management Plan.

Conduct the 2004 Bushfire Build Safe Seminar in Denmark. The seminar is intended to increase knowledge about building requirements and standards in bushfire prone areas and encourage better building design and location.
Ipswich City Council - Enhancement of GIS for Natural Disaster Management

Expansion of the Council’s GIS to include disaster management issues. This will involve adding records of the current Counter Disaster Committee and the new Local Disaster Management Group to the GIS. These will include the locations and capability of all emergency response resources, community resources and records of jobs undertaken in response to natural disaster events.
Ipswich City Council - Preparation of Local Disaster Management Plan

Prepare the Ipswich Disaster Mitigation Plan, incorporating a number of the disaster mitigation and preparedness treatment strategies contained within the Ipswich Natural Disaster Mitigation Plan, as well as reviewing the operational components of the current Ipswich Counter Disaster Plan.
Ipswich City Council - Gravel Road Upgrade

Upgrade two sections of gravel road which have suffered significant damage on a recurring basis as trial projects. The proposed treatments will comprise various forms of protection to the downstream face of road embankment and other ancillary works to reduce overtopping impacts. The two locations will enable subsequent decisions to be made about the most cost effective treatment and its wider application throughout the City.

Purchase of hardware and software to capture information from the Bureau of Meteorology’s (BOM) ALERT warning stations together with real time data verification, and develop a flood forecasting model based on the existing RAFTS hydrological model. This information will allow more detailed and earlier information regarding flood forecasting than is possible from the BOM warnings alone in order to assist with decisions as to activation of the Local Disaster Plan.
Coastal zone management study and plan
Preparation of a management plan to address the threat of coastal erosion caused by severe storms and cyclones to communities at Lennox Head and Patches Beach.
Rehabilitation of the Ardent Street drain outlet to ensure the integrity of the South Grafton levee system.
Development of an emergency risk management plan for the Lismore local government area (including villages, urban areas and rural land sharing communities).
Identification and mapping of high risk flood affected rural areas in the Richmond River floodplain. Includes incorporation of data into a GIS system.
Development of an emergency risk management plan for the Richmond Valley local government area.

Implementation of mitigation measures identified in the Casino and Mid Richmond floodplain risk management study and plans. Includes flood warning, emergency planning and community awareness programmess for Casino, Coraki, Woodburn, Rileys Hill and Broadwater.
Emergency risk management study of natural hazards in the Central Darling local government area. Includes the towns of Wilcannia, Menindee, Ivanhoe and White Cliffs.
Emergency risk management study of natural hazards in the Macquarie River Catchment centred on Dubbo.
Aerial photographs of the Forbes local government area for inclusion into Council’s GIS mapping system improving the management of future flood events.
Rural flood study of the Lachlan River at Condobolin
Detailed flood study of the rural areas surrounding Condobolin affected by flooding from the Lachlan River.
Emergency risk management study of natural hazards in the Macquarie River Catchment centred on Narromine.
Toongabbie Creek flood mitigation works (Briens Road Culvert)
Culvert modifications to improve the waterway capacity of Toongabbie Creek at Briens Road.
Voluntary purchase of 2 properties in Wentworthville subject to flooding from Toongabbie Creek.
Installation of a new ALERT river station on the Myall River upstream from Bulahdelah.
Installation of an additional water level recorder on Wallis Lake to obtain true representation of wind/wave climate on lake.
Emergency risk management study and disaster mitigation strategy
Comprehensive emergency risk management study and disaster mitigation strategy for the Great Lakes, Greater Taree and Gloucester region.
Emergency Services directories for the Peel East, Avon South, South West Corner and Albany regions

Create Emergency Services directories for the Peel East, Avon South, South West Corner and Albany regions of WA. Information includes topographic, cadastral and hydrographic data, power transmission lines, water and gas pipelines, roads and transmission towers, etc.
Undertake a multi-hazard risk assessment of the LeFevre Peninsula.
Constructi an off-take weir and associated works to complete the Little Para River overflow channel.
Enlarge and upgrade the Parafield Airport west drain to improve flow capacity and reduce flooding in the surrounding area.

Evaluate issues impacting on residential dwellings in high fire risk areas. A Fire Risk Mitigation Guide will be developed as a result of this research and will be supplied to the Housing Industry and consumers in a Web format to direct the building orientation and construction of the dwelling giving consideration to local site characteristics to minimise bushfire impacts.
Scoping Study for a Cyclone Shelter Program

Identify public and private buildings in all areas prone to cyclonic weather which are suitable and code compliant (or can be upgraded) to be used to temporarily house community members during cyclonic conditions. The project will also include investigating the costs associated with the potential construction of new buildings and the development of a strategy and implementation plan for the provision of cyclone shelters.
LGAQ Disaster Management, Capability Development and Implementation Project

Conduct a study as a means to increase the capacity of Local Government to respond to corporate planning, risk assessment and disaster mitigation. The project will focus on the development of resources and tools shifting the paradigm from response to include strategic planning for disasters and the development of frameworks for ensuring priority risks are assessed and funded for the best social and economic outcomes.
Local Government Storm Tide Mapping Project

Produce purpose designed storm tide emergency management maps to a common standard for all Queensland coastal communities with a storm tide risk. These maps are essential to effectively prepare communities for, and manage, evacuations.
South East Queensland Disaster Communications Project: Promoting Safe, Sustainable Communities

Develop and implement a strategic framework to support regionally consistent educational and early warning strategies for disaster-prone communities. It will include the incorporation of the needs of all key providers and spheres of government and will address all phases of a disaster from planning and preparation to response and recovery.
Cape Byron Sand Lobe - sand extraction feasibility study

Scoping study to assess the feasibility of extracting sand from the Cape Byron Sand Lobe to protect beachfront property, private dwellings and public infrastructure at Byron Bay-Belongil and New Brighton from coastal erosion caused by storm events.
Tweed Valley community flood awareness programme
Flood awareness programme for residents of the Tweed Valley. Includes a media campaign, installation of flood markers and preparation of pamphlets and web site.
Design of a levee system to protect Hillston from flooding of the Lachlan River.
Flood study of Ardlethan township and surrounding areas.
Wagga Wagga levee and river bank rehabilitation works
Levee and river bank rehabilitation works along the Murrumbidgee River between Small Street and the Wagga Wagga Tourist Information Centre to stabilise the levee and prevent failure or collapse.
Eastern Industrial levee - feasibility and environmental assessment
Study to assess the feasibility and environmental impact of the construction of Eastern Industrial levee.
Installation of up to 14 automatic rainfall stations throughout the Gosford City area from Wamberal in the north to Patonga in the south.
Terrigal Grassland Avenue Catchment flood mitigation works
Flood mitigation works to improve flood protection for 18 residential dwellings in Grassland Avenue and surrounding streets.
Voluntary purchase and demolition of 1 property in Gosford (162 Showground Road) subject to flooding from Narara Creek.
Digital Elevation Model for South Australia
Develop a state wide high resolution Digital Elevation Model to assist in identifying and modelling risks to communities.
Undertake a feasibility study to investigate options for a mobile stock disposal system that can be employed at any site in the State after a natural disaster.
Primary Industries and Resources South Australia
Conduct a one-day seminar in Adelaide involving a broad cross section of community safety facilitators in South Australia to develop community facilitation and engagement techniques.
SA Fire and Emergency Services Commission
Flood Awareness, Flood Warning and Response in South Australia
Review and update the 5-Year Flood Warning Development Plan and prioritise required improvements.
South Australian Flood Warning Consultative Committee
Upgrading of existing Bailey Bridge stock and purchase of additional components to provide temporary crossings when permanent bridges are lost due to flood or bushfire.
Department of Infrastructure, Energy and Resources
Disaster Alert - community warning and information web site
Development of a natural disaster hazard website providing Tasmanian’s with up to date information about current events (nature, severity, geographical location, road closures, etc).
Department of Police and Public Safety
Engaging the Community - Floods and You
Statewide strategy to improve community awareness and preparedness for floods. Focuses on high flood risk areas of the State.
Forging Links - Emergency Management and Local Government
Printing and distribution of the Forging Links - Emergency Management and Local Government information kit to all local governments in the State.
Tasmanian State Emergency Service and Local Govt Assoc of Tasmania
Victorian Flood Data dataset infill project
Updating of the Victorian Flood Data dataset to include details of recently completed flood related studies.
Development of a community education and engagement strategy for bushfire management.

Three-year project to upgrade some 4,800 kms of critical roads and tracks in parks and forests for use in fire prevention and fire management activities. The project will target roads in the State’s highest bushfire risk areas - Otways, Dandenongs and Macedon area.
Flood risk review for Victorian caravan parks
Study to identify all caravan/camping parks at risk from flooding in Victoria and develop approaches, including appropriate planning controls, to mitigate the effects of flooding in such areas.
Adams Creek/Edinburgh Parks Flood Mitigation Dams
Construct flood mitigation dams in Adams Creek adjacent to Gooronga Drive and Turner Drive, Edinburgh Parks.
Flood and Fire Mitigation in Goyder

Conduct one bushfire and two flood risk assessment studies (Council-wide and at Burra), develop a flood data base to identify vulnerable properties, and undertake channel improvement works in Eudunda.
Floodplain management plan for Russel Creek and Merri River
Preparation of a floodplain managagement plan for Russel Creek and the Merri River at North Warrnambool.
Implementation of high priority mitigation measures addressing coastal hazards in the Manly local government area.
Geotechnical survey of public lands affected by coastal hazards
Detailed geotechnical assessment of coastal hazards in the Manly local government area to determine suitable management strategies.
Real-time burnt area and flood mapping
Undertake satellite mapping of flooded or burnt areas across Australia for improved emergency management.
Remote sensing technologies for flood risk management
Undertake scoping study to examine and prototype the application of remote sensing technologies to complement existing flood monitoring and warning systems.
Establish direct access to key spatial information in a readaily accessible form from various sources across government for emergency mitigation.
Towards a National Bushfire Warning and Management System

Undertake scoping and costing for the establishment of a national system to access digital spatial information data to facilitate bushfire mitigation and response. The project will initially provide a single point of access to the currently available different operational systems but ultimately unify these systems to create a more robust, national-scale operational system able to deal with large, national emergencies and associated high demand for information based on near real-time satellite observations.
Profiling of bushfire arsonists in Western Australia
Research into the profile of bushfire arsonists to improve community targeted arson reduction activities.
Fire and Emergency Services Authority of WA
Enhance the ‘Planning for Bushfire Protection’ land development and bushfire protection guide, and identification of building protection zone dimensions.
Fire and Emergency Services Authority of WA

talk.start.para: asked the Minister representing the Minister for Transport and Regional Services, upon notice, on 17 December 2004:

item.label: (1) (a)
item.para: What is the current annual budget of the Tamworth Aeronautical College; and (b) from what sources are funds provided.
What is the current level of cost recovery by way of fees and other contributions from industry.
Do any industry participants provide funds, scholarships or make other contributions in cash or in kind; if so, what are they.
How many students are currently enrolled at the end of 2004.
What is the current drop-out rate for 2004.
What capital contributions were made to establish the school by the Commonwealth and others.
(7) (a) How was Tamworth chosen as the site; (b) what other sites were considered; (c) why were other sites deemed to be unsuitable; and (d) who made the final decision and when.

item.label: (7) (a)
item.para: How was Tamworth chosen as the site; (b) what other sites were considered; (c) why were other sites deemed to be unsuitable; and (d) who made the final decision and when.
What other qualifications beyond courses completed at the school are required to obtain a licensed aircraft engineer’s certificate.

talker.name: Campbell, Sen Ian
talker.role: Minister for the Environment and Heritage
talker.name: Senator Ian Campbell
